data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 27 April 2024, Last Generation activists staged a protest at the airport in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg), some covering themselves in fake blood and laying down in front of the entrance area as if dead, to draw attention to what they consider unjust subsidies for climate-damaging air travel and to demand the removal of short-haul destinations from the program and a ban on private jets from 2026. The activists also accused the airport, the city and the state of greenwashing and dishonesty in fulfilling their legal climate protection mandate. Another group of Last Generation activists staged a protest at Marienplatz and distributed food previously taken from supermarkets' garbage containers to draw attention to the issue of food waste in the face of rising prices and increasing food shortages worldwide and to the lack of a legal framework to curb food waste.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 25 April 2024, more than 50 Last Generation activists with their bikes staged a protest at Blaues Wunder in Dresden (Sachsen) and blocked one lane of the road against the termination of a traffic test and to call on politicians to meet climate goals. The traffic test started in mid-April and created cycling lanes on Blaues Wunder but was terminated due to traffic congestions during rush hour.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 22 April 2024, 4 Last Generation activists gathered in front of the Aida building in Rostock (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) with a banner, to protest against cruise ships, highlighting the impact on climate change. They also glued posters to the windows of the Aida Cruises headquarters.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 April 2024, at the call of various organizations, including FFF, around 280 people gathered along the A100 highway Berlin (Berlin), to protest against the expansion of the 17th section of the A100 highway, prioritizing climate protection and sustainable transportation alternatives over further highway construction. The demonstrators marched on foot, some with bicycles, skateboards, or scooters.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 April 2024, around 100 activists from various climate protection initiatives like Last Generation, XR, and VCD gathered in Berlin - Tempelhof-Schoneberg (Berlin), to protest against the continuation of the construction of the Berlin city highway A100, citing concerns about its environmental impact and prioritization of road infrastructure over sustainable transportation alternatives.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 April 2024, around 101 Last Generation and 'Climate Network Heidelberg' (Klimanetz Heidelberg) activists gathered in Heidelberg (Baden-Wurttemberg), demanding increased climate action. Some activists staged a street blockade, which led to police officers carrying physically activists off the streets.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 April 2024, around 100 Last Generation activists gathered in Bremen (Bremen), to protest against climate inaction, by blocking an intersection. Despite police intervention, approximately 60 individuals refused to vacate the roadway, resulting in their temporary detention and the physical dispersal of the demonstration.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 April 2024, around 25 Last Generation activists gathered in Saarbrucken (Saarland), demanding increased government action on climate change, resulting in 6 participants being taken into custody by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 April 2024, around 90 people, including Last Generation activists, gathered in Heidelberg (Baden-Wurttemberg), to protest for climate action, with some of them later blocking Bismarck Street. The protest aimed to pressure for stronger climate policies, while expressing dissatisfaction with current governmental efforts and calling for immediate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 April 2024, around 70 Last Generation activists gathered in Tubingen (Baden-Wurttemberg), demanding increased government action on climate change, by blocking traffic for over three hours and opposing the construction of a tunnel.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 19 April 2024, at the call of FFF, around 200 people gathered in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg), demanding climate justice.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 19 April 2024, around 20 XR activists gathered in Babelsberg district in Potsdam (Brandenburg), by blocking the central intersection temporarily, aiming to engage with drivers and pedestrians about climate issues. The event caused traffic disruptions.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 17 April 2024, 12 Last Generation activists protested in Karlsruhe (Baden-Wurttemberg), by blocking the entrance to the Oberrhein oil refinery with kayaks, demanding climate action with a sign reading 'Stop - closed due to climate catastrophe'. The event aimed to draw attention to the environmental impact of fossil fuel operations.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 17 April 2024, 15 Last Generation activists protested in Saarbrucken (Saarland), by temporarily blocking traffic at ten traffic lights in the city center, utilizing a tactic known as 'swarming' to draw attention to the climate crisis and criticize the inaction of the German government.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 13 April 2024, about 40 Last Generation activists participated in a climate protest in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin) and tried blocking the road. The police intervened and prevented a blockade by pushing the activists away. The activists spoke of violence and repression to define the intervention. The protest was part of a nationwide protest week under the motto 'Resistance Spring' organized by the Last Generation to call for more climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 13 April 2024, around 30 Last Generation activists staged a protest in Dusseldorf (Nordrhein-Westfalen) and blocked a bridge to raise awareness for climate change and demand more climate action and a speed limit for highways. The police intervened, broke up the protest and carried about a dozen activists onto the sidewalk. The protest was part of a nationwide protest week under the motto 'Resistance Spring' organized by the Last Generation to call for more climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 13 April 2024, under the motto 'Democracy needs honesty', slightly more than 50 Last Generation activists staged a climate protest in Hamburg - Altona (Hamburg), formed a human chain and blocked a road near the Altona railway station to demand more climate protection. The police intervened physically and cleared the blockade. The protest was part of a nationwide protest week under the motto 'Resistance Spring' organized by the Last Generation to call for more climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 13 April 2024, Last Generation activists staged a protest in Aschaffenburg (Bayern) to call for change in the society and economy and new approaches to the climate debate. The protest was part of a nationwide protest week under the motto 'Resistance Spring' organized by the Last Generation to call for more climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 12 April 2024, at the call of an alliance consisting of several, unspecified left-wing groups, 20 climate activists, including members of IL, Last Generation, and other climate organizations, participated in a protest in Heidelberg (Baden-Wurttemberg) against a local Tesla factory, its high water consumption, and the entire company which they consider a sham solution for climate protection. The protesters also called for a shift in transportation and an expansion of public mobility services.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 April 2024, Last Generation activists protested in Halle (Saale) (Sachsen-Anhalt), temporarily blocking traffic at various intersections, to raise awareness about climate change.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 April 2024, around 100 climate activists from Ende Gelaende gathered at the Scholven coal-fired power plant in Gelsenkirchen (Nordrhein-Westfalen), blocking access rails, to demand an immediate coal phase-out. The protest was dispersed by the police in the afternoon.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 April 2024, at the call of Last Generation, numerous people protested in Gottingen (Niedersachsen), aiming to raise awareness about social inequality and the urgency of addressing ongoing crises, such as climate change and the deterioration of democracy.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
organizers: NGPM: Network of the German Peace Movement
data.description: On 1 April 2024, more than 200 people, including members of the 'International Fellowship of Reconciliation' (Internationaler Versohnungsbund), Pax Christi, Greenpeace, the church, Muslims, and the 'International Campaign to Ban Nuclear Weapons' (Internationale Kampagne zum Verbot von Atomwaffen) participated in a peace protest in Buchel (Rheinland-Pfalz) against war, rearmament, and nuclear weapons. The participants also called for more investments in climate protection and social services rather than rearmament. The event was part of the traditional annual Easter peace protests coordinated by the NGPM and supported by 50 initiatives and organizations, including labor unions, political parties, the church (Christian groups), and migration organizations.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 22 March 2024, Last Generation activists gathered at the airport in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg), demanding climate action and criticizing the environmental impact of the airport, particularly focusing on issues such as private jet use and kerosene subsidies.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 18 March 2024, people, including Parents For Future Koln, Grannies For Future Koln, and Christians for Future Koln, participated in a protest in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) for democracy and climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, under the motto 'Democracy needs honesty', around 130 Last Generation activists staged a protest in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin), while around 20 of them blocked Warschauer Strasse with sit-ins, to raise awareness about social inequality, the climate crisis and its negative health effects, and to demand more democracy. The police intervened, carried the protesters off the street, and prevented them from staging other blockades. The action was part of a series of so-called 'disobedient assemblies' taking place across the country that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, Last Generation activists staged a protest in Bremen (Bremen) and interrupted traffic on the Am Wall road to demand climate justice. Passers-by tried to snatch the protesters' placards, force them off the intersection, and physically attacked some of the protesters, as well as a cameraman who was covering the event. The action was part of a series of so-called 'disobedient assemblies' taking place across the country that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, around 30 people, including Ende Gelande activists, staged a protest in Brunsbuttel (Schleswig-Holstein) and blocked the access road to the swimming LNG terminal to demand an immediate stop to imports of LNG. The protest was part of a wider protest action that day, during which climate groups in a total of six countries bordering the North Sea demonstrated against fossil fuel infrastructure and the exploitation of oil and gas deposits in the North Sea.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, people, including several movements such as Parents for Future and 'NATO Defender', participated in a registered protest in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) to demand faster assimilation of climate policies to climate change.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, about 200 people, including Last Generation activists, participated in a protest in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) and blocked the roads around Ebertplatz to demand better climate protection. The action was part of a series of so-called 'disobedient assemblies' taking place across the country that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, about 120 people, including Last Generation activists, participated in a protest in Munchen (Bayern) to demand better climate protection and call for the abandonment of coal, oil, and gas. The action was part of a series of so-called 'disobedient assemblies' taking place across the country that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, 150 people, including 100 Last Generation activists, participated in an unregistered flashmob protest in the departure hall of the airport in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) to demand better climate protection and an end to short-distance flights. The action was part of a series of so-called 'disobedient assemblies' taking place across the country that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, about 150 people, including Last Generation activists, participated in a protest in Freiburg im Breisgau (Baden-Wurttemberg) and blocked roads near the main train station to demand better climate protection measures. The police intervened and carried the protesters off the road. The action was part of a series of so-called 'disobedient assemblies' taking place across the country that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, 150 (according to organizers) or up to 50 (according to police) people, including Last Generation activists, participated in a protest in Karlsruhe (Baden-Wurttemberg), blocking Durlacher Allee, to demand better climate protection measures. The police intervened and carried the protesters off the road. The action was part of a series of so-called 'disobedient assemblies' taking place across the country that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 March 2024, about 150 climate activists, including Last Generation activists, participated in a protest in Regensburg (Bayern) and blocked an intersection to demand better climate protection and call for the abandonment of coal, oil, and gas. The police intervened, carrying more than 25 protesters off the road and temporarily arresting two participants. The action was part of a series of so-called 'disobedient assemblies' taking place across the country that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 14 March 2024, Greenpeace activists protested outside the headquarters of DWS Investment, a Deutsche Bank fund company in Frankfurt am Main (Hessen), using 25 red oil barrels and banners to denounce the fund's investment policies regarding fossil fuels. They aimed to draw attention to what they perceive as inadequate efforts by DWS to implement climate protection measures, accusing the company of 'greenwashing' its financial products.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 10 March 2024, climate activists from various movements, including from Last Generation, gathered in Heidelberg (Baden-Wurttemberg) to protest against the environmental impact of Heidelberg Materials and an associated court case, displaying banners reading 'Cement is everywhere - So are we'. The event happened in response to the cancellation of the trial against fellow activist Raul Semmler, who, along with others, had blocked the entrance to the cement plant, highlighting its greenhouse gas emissions.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 March 2024, XR activists staged a protest in Dresden (Sachsen) by blocking a street intersection to demand fair climate protection and to protest against environmental destruction in the Heidebogen forest area, which is being cleared for gravel extraction.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 March 2024, around a dozen Last Generation activists gathered in Halle (Saale) (Sachsen-Anhalt), demanding an end to fossil fuel subsidies and urging Germany to achieve climate neutrality by 2030.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 March 2024, at the call of Ver.di, 3,500 people gathered in Dortmund (Nordrhein-Westfalen), demanding more climate action and a stronger and sustainable public transport system. The event was part of a nationwide campaign called 'We Ride Together' by the climate movement FFF and Ver.di, focusing on the need for better public transportation jobs.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 March 2024, Last Generation activists participated in a protest in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin), smearing the facade of the Federal Chancellery with orange paint, while several of the activists lay or sat down in front of it. The protesters called on the German government to take on its responsibility for the younger generation with regard to climate change. The police intervened to stop the protest and temporarily arrested 16 activists aged 13 to 16. The methods used during the police intervention caused criticism and led to investigations as one policeman knelt on the head of a Last Generation activist making it difficult for her to breathe.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 March 2024, Extinction Rebellion activists participated in a protest in Bonn (Nordrhein-Westfalen) and blocked Reuterstrasse at intervals of several minutes to point out the urgency of the climate crisis and the importance of a shift in transportation policies.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 March 2024, between 150 people (according to police) and 500 (according to the organizers), including environmental activists and activists of the alliance 'Stop fossil subsidies' (Stoppt fossile Subventionen), which consists of several environmental organizations, including XR and Last Generation, participated in a cycling protest in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin), blocking Elsenbrucke. They demonstrated against the expansion of the highway 100 in Berlin, demanded better funding for social issues, an end to all subsidies for fossil fuels, and climate justice worldwide. They also criticized the company car privilege and the commuter allowance.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 1 March 2024, at the call of FFF, around 100 people staged a protest in Altotting (Bayern), advocating for cleaner energy. They marched through the streets chanting slogans in favor of climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 1 March 2024, at the call of BUND and FFF, around 100 people participated in a cycling protest in Biberach (Baden-Wurttemberg) to call for a social and ecological shift in transportation and climate protection. The participants demanded more commitment from society and politicians to ecological and social mobility and better public transport with improved working conditions, more staff and sufficient funding. The event was part of a nationwide climate strike.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 1 March 2024, at the call of FFF and Ver.di, about 3,200 people, including a Bundestag member (The Greens), public transport employees and representatives of MLPD, participated in a protest in Hannover (Niedersachsen) for climate protection and better working conditions in the public transport sector. The event was part of a nationwide campaign called 'We Ride Together' organized by Ver.di and FFF, focusing on the need for better public transportation jobs.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
data.description: On 1 March 2024, at the call of Ver.di and FFF, about 400 people, including about 30 to 40 Ver.di members, State Parliament Members (SPD), Bundestag Members (SPD), environmental activists, IGM representatives, as well as members of MLPD and REBELL, participated in a protest in Bochum (Nordrhein-Westfalen) for climate protection and better working conditions in the public transport sector. The event was part of a nationwide campaign called 'We Ride Together' organized by Ver.di and FFF, focusing on the need for better public transportation jobs.

organizers: NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union
data.description: On 18 February 2024, around 80 people, including representatives of ADFC, BUND, NABU, 'Climate decision Duisburg' (Klimaentscheid Duisburg), The Left, The Greens and Volt Europa, participated in a cycling protest in Duisburg (Nordrhein-Westfalen) against the tree policies of the city administration and the felling of trees. They argued that although preserving the trees was costly, it was worth it from a climate perspective.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 February 2024, at the call of Ver.di and FFF, around 2,500 people, including bus drivers and several local and state politicians (FDP and 'South Schleswig Voters' Association' (Sudschleswigsche Wahlerverband (SSW)) participated in a protest in Kiel (Schleswig-Holstein) and handed over a petition for better public transport funding to politicians to tackle climate change. The bus drivers from municipal companies have been on a warning strike since Wednesday, private companies joined yesterday.

During the third blockade on St. Petersburger Strasse towards the campus, one driver drove towards the demonstrators in front of him, who reflexively put their hands on the hood of the car, the police intervened to stop the driver.

About a dozen other activists, protested nearby with inflatable boats.

data.description: On 23 September 2023, around 130 people, including Last Generation activists, protested in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf (Berlin) for climate reasons and blocked the intersection Potsdamer Strasse/Kurfurstendamm with a sit-in. The police intervened, carried the protesters off the street and determined the identities of a good 100 people.

data.description: On 22 September 2023, Greenpeace activists protested on the Spree Canal at the Reichstag in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) to criticize the lack of willingness of the government to initiate concrete climate protection measures. The protest took place in the context of the first reading in the Bundestag that day, at which changes to the Climate Protection Act were to be discussed.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
organizers: NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union
data.description: On 21 September 2023, environmentalists, including members of NABU, BUND, Robin Wood, and Deutsche Umwelthilfe (DUH) (German Environmental Relief) demonstrated in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) against the planned burning of wood in the Tiefstack power plant due to concerns of its impacts on the climate and nature.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 18 September 2023, a man sprayed tear gas at the face of several Last Generation members who gathered and blocked traffic at Prenzlauer Promenade (A114), corner of Pasewalker Street, Prenzlauer Street, Granitz Street, Prenzlauer Allee, and Frobel Street in Berlin - Pankow to call for climate protection. He also tried to kick them. Another man poured a Coca-Cola drink on a demonstrator. Police officers intervened to remove the demonstrators who glued themselves to the road.

data.description: On 18 September 2023, members of Last Generation and their supporters gathered in front of the city's District Court in Oldenburg to call for more efforts in climate protection and against the criminalization of the movement. Protesters called on the judges to recognize civil disobedience as means of protest and not to prosecute them.

data.description: On 15 September 2023, around 130 people, including members of Last Generation, demonstrated from the Platz der Republik to the Sonnenhausplatz and on to the Alter Markt in Monchengladbach for climate protection. An unknown person threw two raw eggs in the direction of the group on Sonnenhausplatz (no one was injured). The event was part of a 13th Global Climate Strike called by the FFF to demand the implementation of promised funds ('climate money') to tackle rising carbon and energy prices on citizens, more laws to reduce climate-damaging emissions by 65% by 2030, a quick exit from fossil fuels (coal, oil, gas), and a mobility shift.

data.description: On 9 September 2023, 72 people, belonging to Greenpeace, Fridays for Future Saarland, Students for Future Saar and the association Weltveranderer, participated in a dance protest in Saarbrucken (Regionalverband Saarbrucken, Saarland) for a socially just climate policy.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 September 2023, about 20 Extinction Rebellion activists protested at the intersection at Strassburger Platz in Dresden (Sachsen) to demand climate-neutral mobility.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 September 2023, 17 people, including Last Generation activists, protested in Ulm (Baden-Wurttemberg) against the preventive custody of climate activists in Bayern and against the climate policies of the federal government.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 September 2023, Last Generation activists protested with a sit-in in front of the train station in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) to show solidarity with fellow activists in Munich, especially those taken into preventive custody until the end of the International Mobility Show Germany (IAA Mobility) taking place in the city. Moreover, 12 Last Generation activists protested on Arnulf-Klett-Platz with a slow protest march, against the climate policies of the government and the imprisonment of other activists. The police intervened in both cases, carrying the activists off the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 September 2023, Fridays for Future activists protested in front of the Bundestag in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) against the weakening of the climate law and for compliance with climate goals.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 September 2023, about 30 Last Generation activists as well as family and friends of imprisoned activists protested in front of the Stadelheim Prison in Munchen (Bayern) against preventative detention of 29 climate activists.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 September 2023, during the morning and the afternoon, 27 members of Last Generation gathered at Marienplatz to march to Karlsplatz, which they blocked during the afternoon, in Munchen to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 September 2023, around a dozen Greenpeace members demonstrated inside the exhibition center during the opening of the International Motor Show (IAA) in Munchen against the event and for climate protection. They called for fewer cars and more trains to achieve it. Demonstrators interrupted the Chancellor's speech and climbed on cars.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 September 2023, between 7 and 8 XR members gathered for an unregistered protest in front of the main entrance of the exhibition center in Munchen against the International Motor Show (IAA) and for climate protection. They criticized the mining of lithium and heavy SUVs. Demonstrators climbed into one of the large water basins and used pyrotechnics. They gathered separately and after the Attac's protest on the same day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 4 September 2023, members of Last Generation demonstrated and blocked an intersection near the end of the highway 94 in Munchen for climate protection. An angry driver slapped one activist in the face.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 4 September 2023, 4 members of Last Generation blocked traffic on Invalidenstrasse at Europaplatz in front of Berlin Central Station in Berlin - Mitte to denounce the criminalization of the movement, show support to 27 people in Bavaria who have been in preventive detention, and call for more climate protection. Emergency services (including police officers) intervened to remove the activists from the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 4 September 2023, a small group of members of Extinction Rebellion gathered on the highway Middle Ring (B2R) next to the BMW headquarters in Munchen against the International Motor Show (IAA) and for climate protection. They called for more funding for public transport and not for highways. 2 people rappelled down from a bridge.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 4 September 2023, a group of members of Last Generation demonstrated and blocked traffic at the exit of the B100 road in Halle (Saale) to call for climate protection. Police officers intervened to remove several activists who glued themselves to the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 September 2023, members of Last Generation slowed down traffic by marching from Wittenbergplatz in Berlin - Tempelhof-Schoneberg towards Adenauerplatz in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf to protest against the preventive detention in Bavaria of 27 climate activists.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 September 2023, members of Last Generation demonstrated on Landwehrplatz in Saarbrucken in solidarity with a condemned climate activist. They called on the government to do more for climate protection. Protesters demanded a social council to plan the phase-out of the use of fossil fuels in Germany by 2030, a speed limit of 100 km/h on highways, and a 9-euro ticket for all to access public transport.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 September 2023, throughout the afternoon, 11 members of Last Generation gathered on the Konrad Adenauer Bridge between Mannheim and Ludwigshafen in Mannheim for climate protection. 5 people stuck to the road in the direction of Mannheim, and 4 activists on the other side of the road, and another action took place in the feeding lane between squares Q6 and Q7.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 September 2023, 3 members of Last Generation glued themselves to the road, blocked the B37 highway west of the Theodor Heuss Bridge and protested in Heidelberg to call for more actions to achieve the 2023 climate protection plan. Demonstrators were arrested.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 September 2023, around a dozen members of Last Generation and Science Rebellion (XR) blocked traffic on Adenauerallee (B9) at the same time near the Koenig Museum in Bonn to call for climate protection. Police officers intervened to remove the glue from those who stuck themselves to the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 1 September 2023, throughout the day, at least 5 climate activists, members of Last Generation and Robin Wood, carried out several actions and blocked traffic at the intersection of Sonnenstrasse and Priemlayerstrasse, Donnersberger Street, and Arnulfstrasse in Neuhausen, in Munchen (Bayern). Other blockades happened simultaneously at Furstenrieder Street, Ammerseestrasse, and Feldherrnhalle. They called for climate protection. A Robin Wood activist put a banner on Odeonsplatz against the International Motor Show (IAA) to denounce car companies' greenwashing. 10 activists were arrested by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 31 August 2023, during the morning, members of Last Generation blocked traffic on the Petuelring (westbound direction)/corner of Schleissheimer Street in Munchen (Bayern) to call for more climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 31 August 2023, 5 members of Last Generation blocked traffic by gluing themselves to August-Bebel Street and demonstrated in Rostock (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) to call on the federal government to do more for climate protection. Protesters demanded the reintroduction of the 9-euro ticket for public transport, a speed limit of 100 km/h on highways, and a social council. They were physically removed by police officers.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 30 August 2023, almost 30 members of Last Generation demonstrated and marched slowly from the main train station, via Juri-Gagarin-Ring, Valley Knot, Andreasstrasse to Domplatz, in Erfurt (Thuringen) to call on the government to establish a social council and climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 30 August 2023, almost 20 members of Last Generation demonstrated, marching from the Petrikirche to Doberaner Platz, in Rostock (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 30 August 2023, at the call of Last Generation, around 30 members gathered at Schwetzinger Terrasse in Heidelberg (Baden-Wurttemberg) and demonstrated on Speyerer Street to call on the government to do more for climate protection. Several activists were arrested by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 30 August 2023, over 80 people, mostly members of Last Generation, demonstrated and slowed traffic down from the Isartor to the Bavarian State Parliament in Munchen (Bayern) to call for climate protection. 11 sat down on the street and were carried away by police officers. Around 10 people threw paintballs at the building of the Bavarian State Parliament.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 30 August 2023, members of Last Generation demonstrated at Weender Tor in Gottingen (Niedersachsen) for climate protection. Passers-by tore the activists' banners and one female passer-by punched one of the demonstrators in the face. No injuries were reported.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 29 August 2023, climate activists participated in road blockages organized by Last Generation on multiple streets in Munchen (Bayern), including at the intersections of Leopoldstrasse and Karl-Weinmair Strasse, of Schenkendorfstrasse and Leopoldstrasse as well as of Einsteinstrasse and Leuchtenbergring. Police forces intervened and removed the activists from the street.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 August 2023, 6 Last Generation activists blocked the Vogelsangbrucke towards the inner city in Esslingen am Neckar (Esslingen, Baden-Wurttemberg) to draw attention to climate policy deficits. Four of them glued themselves onto the intersection Vogelsangbrucke and Maillestrasse and two others glued their hands together. The police intervened and removed the protesters from the street.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 August 2023, Last Generation activists protested at different street intersections across Munchen (Bayern), with 5 blocking Arnulfstrasse/Donnersbergerbrucke, 10 blocking Innsbrucker Ring/Rosenheimer Street, others blocking Berg am Laim Street/Leuchtenbergring, 2 blocking Schenkendorf Street/Petuelring, and others blocking Luise-Kiesselbachplatz, to demand more climate protection. Police intervened and removed the activists from the street. One car driver pushed two activists at walking speed with his car at the Innsbrucker Ring/Rosenheimer Street intersection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 August 2023, Last Generation activists protested in Gottingen (Niedersachsen), blocking the Weender Tor intersection, to demand more climate action. Some of them glued themselves onto the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 27 August 2023, Last Generation activists protested during an e-sports tournament at the Gamescom in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to call for more climate protection.

data.description: On 27 August 2023, thousands of people participated in a rally by the artists' initiative Arsch-huh in cooperation with Fridays for Future and Junge Generation in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 27 August 2023, Last Generation activists protested in Werder (Havel) (Potsdam-Mittelmark, Brandenburg) by blocking the entrance to the harbor, where the fair 'Boot & Fun Inwater' was taking place, with six paddle boats to increase pressure on the federal government to take stronger action against the climate crisis.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 25 August 2023, Last Generation activists blocked roads at several spots around Munchen, demanding immediate climate action.

data.description: On 25 August 2023, about 200 members of the FFF movement gathered for a demonstrative cycle ride in Kiel, demanding immediate climate action, in particular through support of carbon-neutral public transport.

data.description: On 24 August 2023, FFF activists and members of other environmental groups blocked roads at several spots across Berlin, demanding immediate climate action and carbon-neutral transport.

data.description: On 24 August 2023, several dozen Last Generation activists blocked roads at several spots around Munchen, demanding immediate climate action.

data.description: On 23 August 2023, 21 Last Generation activists gathered for a march in Dresden, demanding immediate climate action.

data.description: On 23 August 2023, Last Generation activists gathered for a picket protest in Prien am Chiemsee, demanding immediate climate action. To strengthen their protest, they poured a black liquid to local famous fountains.

data.description: On 23 August 2023, about 40 Last Generation activists blocked roads at several spots across Leipzig, demanding immediate climate action. Law enforcers removed some of them.

data.description: On 22 August 2023, about 50 climate activists belonging to the group 'Ende Gelaende' protested near Brunsbuttel (Dithmarschen, Schleswig-Holstein) by blocking the construction site of a new natural gas pipeline to prevent the construction of the line.

data.description: On 22 August 2023, around 40 climate activists of the Last Generation protested in Regensburg (Bayern) by blocking three access roads to the BMW factory to denounce the continued burning of fossil fuels in the transport sector. Police forces intervened and removed the protesters from the streets.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 August 2023, 17 climate activists of the Last Generation protested Leipzig (Sachsen) by blocking the Augustusplatz with sit-ins on the surrounding streets. 9 of the protesters glued themselves onto the street.

data.description: On 21 August 2023, 55 climate activists of the Last Generation protested in Regensburg (Bayern) by blocking roads. Multiple passerby drivers lend a hand and tired to pull the protesters aside. The police intervened, resolved the protest and took 12 of the protesters into custody.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 August 2023, 6 climate activists of the Last Generation protested in Worms (Rheinland-Pfalz) by gluing themselves onto a road close to the market square. data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 August 2023, climate activists of the Last Generation protested in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) by blocking multiple central streets, including the B27 and Charlottenstrasse, with sit-ins. data.description: On 20 August 2023, 30 climate activists, belonging to Fridays For Future and other organizations, protested during the federal government's open day in front of the Federal Chancellery in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) to draw attention to the climate crisis.

data.description: On 17 August 2023, during the morning, several members of Last Generation demonstrated and blocked two streets in Furth (Bayern) to call for climate protection.

data.description: Around 17 August 2023 (as reported), at the call of Last Generation, people, including members of MLPD, demonstrated in Krefeld (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to denounce the government's responsibility concerning the climate deregulation. data.description: On 17 August 2023, ALG activists demonstrated around the exit of the Frankenschnellweg in Nurnberg (Bayern) to call for climate protection. They glued themselves to the road.

data.description: On 16 August 2023, a small group of Last Generation activists demonstrated and slowed down traffic from Hallmarkt to Glauchaer Platz in Halle (Saale) (Sachsen-Anhalt) to call for more climate action.

data.description: On 16 August 2023, members of Last Generation blocked traffic in the direction of Berliner Street to the train station in Gottingen (Niedersachsen) to call on the government to do more for climate protection.

data.description: On 15 August 2023, up to 80 people participated in a protest organized by Last Generation in Wurzburg (Bayern), with around 20 participants blocking the B19 at several points to demand a shift in the government's transport policy and more climate measures. The police ended the unannounced protest and took 43 protesters into temporary custody.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 14 August 2023, about 20 climate activists participated in a protest organized by Last generation in Esslingen am Neckar (Baden-Wurttemberg) to draw attention to the disregard of the climate protection law and the softening of the Esslinger climate neutrality decision.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 14 August 2023, around 120 people participated in a protest march organized by Last Generation in Wurzburg (Bayern) to demand more climate protection.

data.description: On 13 August 2023, around 150 people participated in a protest organized by the youth organization of the BUND on the Spree in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin) for green energy and more climate justice.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 12 August 2023, 20 Last Generation activists protested at Kottbusser Tor in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin), 17 of which glued themselves onto the road, blocking Skalitzer Strasse at the intersection Adalbertstrasse and Skalitzer Strasse at the intersection Reichenberger Strasse, to raise awareness about the consequences of climate change and demand measures from politicians. data.description: On 11 August 2023, around 300 Fridays for Future activists protested in Luneburg (Niedersachsen), as part of the nationwide summer congress of their movement, for a climate-friendly transport policy and specifically the construction of the Hamburg-Hannover railway line along the A7.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 11 August 2023, 4 Last Generation activists protested on Landingstrasse in Aschaffenburg (Bayern) for more climate protection. Two of them glued themselves onto the road and blocked traffic. Police intervened and removed the activists from the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 10 August 2023, 10 Last Generation activists protested around the main train station in Essen (Nordrhein-Westfalen) by blocking the surrounding roads with sit-ins and by gluing themselves onto it to protest for more climate protection. data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 9 August 2023, 70 members of Last Generation held a protest march starting at Potsdamer Platz and going towards Blucherplatz in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin) for more climate protection.

data.description: Around 8 August 2023 (as reported), 3 members of Last Generation staged a protest and used jackhammers in an attempt to damage the street in front of the Federal Ministry of Transport in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) to call for climate protection. data.description: On 2 August 2023, during the afternoon, 7 members of Last Generation, including an IT employee and an engineer, slowed down traffic on Wolfenbutteler Street and demonstrated in Braunschweig to call for climate protection. They gathered on the occasion of Earth Overshoot Day.

data.description: On 30 July 2023, around 50 climate activists belonging to Extinction Rebellion protested on the road leading to Nurnberg Airport to demand, among other things, a tax on aviation fuel, sales tax on international flights, no tax money for airports and no domestic flights from Nurnberg.

data.description: On 12 July 2023, several members of ALG blocked traffic in Stralsund to call for climate protection and against the LNG terminal. data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 July 2023, around 30 people, including ALG and BUND members, demonstrated across the Theodor Heuss Bridge and towards Bismarckplatz in Heidelberg to denounce that the federal government is not keeping its promises on climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 July 2023, around 20 members of ALG demonstrated at the Alter Markt shop in Potsdam for more climate protection.

data.description: On 3 July 2023, Last Generation activists blocked a road in Berlin - Mitte by gluing themselves to a road, demanding immediate climate action. Police detained six of them - some before they managed to apply the glue.

data.description: On 30 June 2023, Last Generation activists glued themselves to a road in Rosenheim, demanding immediate climate action. Bypassing pedestrians and drivers assaulted some of them.

data.description: On 30 June 2023, ALG activists protested in Augsburg, calling for adequate measures against climate change. Four activists glued themselves to the road and blocked the traffic.

data.description: On 29 June 2023, during the 75th anniversary of the Constitutional Convention, members of Last Generation protested within sight of the old castle on Herreninsel (Rosenheim, Bayern) against the climate policies of the federal government, claiming it undermined the basis of human life and thus endangers humanity, justice and freedom.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 June 2023, around 30 members of ALG blocked traffic in front of the Rose Garden in Mannheim to call for climate protection. They were carried away by police officers.

data.description: On 10 May 2023, ALG activists gathered in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte, demanding immediate climate action. They aimed to block the local street by slow marching, but law enforcers peacefully prevented them from doing so.

data.description: On 10 May 2023, about 15 ALG activists with pickets blocked a highway in Stuttgart, demanding immediate climate action. Law enforcers were present, but did not interfere.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 May 2023, around 500 people gathered at Friedrichs Platz square in Mannheim (Baden-Wurttemberg), riding their bikes in the direction of the Bundesgartenschau building as part of a 'Kidical Mass', to demand more sustainable means of transport and climate protection. The demonstration was organized by ADFC and was part of a nationwide protest weekend with the same demands.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 May 2023, at the call of the Climate Alliance, a group of around 80 people, including members of FFF and affiliates of other environmental organizations, carried out a demonstration around the Pionierhafen port in Karlsruhe, opposing the project to build a second bridge over the Rhine. Demonstrators cited the environmental impact of the project.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 May 2023, a group of ALG activists blocked traffic, gluing their hands to the street, near the main train station in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) to demand more climate action from the federal government.

data.description: On 4 May 2023, members of Extinction Rebellion demonstrated and blocked traffic at Friedrich-List-Platz in Dresden to call on politicians to introduce effective measures against climate change such as rooftop solar panels, wind turbines for local residents, and affordable public transit access for all. They gathered on the occasion of Earth Overshoot Day.

data.description: On 4 May 2023, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg to call for climate protection. Several civilians tried to remove physically the demonstrators from the street.

data.description: On 23 April 2023, six ALG activists blocked the racing track at a Formula-E race in Berlin - Tempelhof-Schoneberg, to protest against the emissions caused by motorsports, and call for climate action. The activists were first removed from the track by security personnel, and later taken into custody by the police.

organizers: NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union
data.description: On 22 April 2023, at the call of ADFC, BUND, NABU, FFF, Greenpeace, and Klimabundnis Siegen-Wittgenstein, around 150 people staged a bicycle protest rally from Platz vor dem Kreishaus in Siegen to Weidenau and back, to protest for climate friendly mobility policy. The protest was part of a national protest day, demanding change in mobility policy.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 22 April 2023, ALG activists gathered at Kurfurstendamm in Berlin - Mitte, to spray paint onto the windows of various luxury boutiques, calling for an end to the increased emissions that rich people account for and demanding climate action. The activists were taken into custody by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 April 2023, at the call of FFF, around 300 people, including Greenpeace and Campact activists, gathered outside a conference center in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg, to demand more climate action by party FDP, which had their general assembly taking place there.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 April 2023, ALG activists staged a protest march from Friedrichshain to Brandenburger Tor in Berlin - Mitte, to call for climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 April 2023, around 30 ALG activists staged a protest march in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf, to call for climate action. The protest march took place on a street, resulting in traffic jams. According to reports, some car owners reacted angrily to the road blockade.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 April 2023, around 30 ALG activists, gathered at Bolle-Festsaale in Berlin - Mitte, to call for climate action. The activists staged a sit-in protest and spilled orange paint in front of the building, where a conference for family businesses was set to take place. More activists gathered in front of the Berlin State Opera, gluing themselves to the tarmac. Simultaneously, around 30 ALG activists, staged a protest march from Brandenburger Tor to Siegessaule in Berlin - Mitte over the same reasons. The protest march took place on the Strasse des 17. Juni street, resulting in traffic jams.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 19 April 2023, around 130 ALG activists staged a protest march in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg, to call for climate action. Activists staged multiple street blockades such as at Straussberger Platz, where six activists glued themselves together, at Schillingbrucke where eleven activists sat on the street to block traffic, and at Kopenicker Strasse where nine activists sat on the street. Further activists blocked a bus of the local BR Volleys team.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 19 April 2023, a total of around 150 ALG activists staged a protest march to Alexanderplatz in Berlin - Mitte, to call for more climate action. A group of ALG activists simultaneously staged a road blockade on the Jannowitzbrucke area of Berlin - Mitte over the same reasons.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 April 2023, 19 members of Extinction Rebellion protested on the stairs of the Altes Museum in Berlin - Mitte to denounce the climate crisis.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 13 April 2023, early morning, people, mostly members of Extinction Rebellion, ALG, and Scientist Rebellion, staged a protest and threw a black liquid (artificial oil) at the building of the headquarters of Coca-Cola on Stralauer Allee in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg to call for social justice, climate protection, and denounce the rich. They also denounced the criminalization of climate protection movements. Protesters were against companies that pollute the oceans, privatize, and threaten life.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 13 April 2023, between 200 and 300 people, mostly members of Extinction Rebellion, Scientist Rebellion, and ALG, threw a black liquid (artificial oil) at the buildings of the FDP headquarters (Reinhardtstrasse), the Hotel Adlon, Shell headquarters, Bayer AG offices, Vattenfall offices, and demonstrated from Invalidenpark towards Pariser Platz in Berlin - Mitte for social justice, climate protection, and denounce the rich. They also were against the criminalization of climate protection movements. Several activists entered the Hotel Adlon, the ignited pyrotechnics on a balcony on the upper floors and unfurled a banner.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 12 April 2023, members of Extinction Rebellion set up a protest camp in Invalidenpark in Berlin - Mitte to draw attention to the climate and biodiversity crisis. They called for the end of the use of fossil fuels in Germany by 2030. Several dozen tents and an event stage have been set up in the park.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 12 April 2023, 14 members of ALG demonstrated and slowed down traffic on Karlstrasse in Dusseldorf to call on mayors to take action to protect the population and the climate. They called for the end of the use of fossil fuels in Germany by 2030. A car driver pushed an activist from behind and the latter hit the roadway but still sat in front of the car to block traffic.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 April 2023, 9 ALG activists blocked the a street at Elbtunnel in Hamburg - Altona, to call for climate action. The activists were removed from the street by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 April 2023, five ALG activists blocked a street at Elbbrucken in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte, gluing themselves to the tarmac, to call for climate action. The activists were removed from the street by the police. Close-by, at Veddeler Damm, six activists tried to glue themselves to the street, yet were removed by the police before they could do so.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 April 2023, 4 ALG activists blocked the Neue Kant street in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf, gluing themselves to the tarmac, to call for climate action. The activists were removed from the street by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 4 April 2023, around 20 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked an intersection in Braunschweig to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 4 April 2023, 9 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic on the Kohlbrand Bridge in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte to call for climate protection. Police officers arrested all the demonstrators.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 April 2023, members of ALG demonstrated and disrupted an SPD event in Lohbrugge in Hamburg - Bergedorf to call for climate protection. The people in the event loudly protested against climate protests. An elderly man stormed the stage and tried to reach the mayor. Bodyguards pushed him away, and police officers arrested him.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 1 April 2023, members of Extinction Rebellion demonstrated in front of Jaguar and Land Rover branches on Kurfurstendamm in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf for more decisive political action against the climate crisis. They called for social justice as they denounced the prices of the cars compared to people struggling with food and energy costs.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 1 April 2023, 7 members of ALG demonstrated along Rovershager Chaussee toward the city center and blocked a street in Rostock to call for climate protection, a 9-euro ticket for public transport, and a 100km/h speed limit on highways. Police officers intervened to carry some of the demonstrators away.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 31 March 2023, at the call of FFF, around 650 people demonstrated at the Ministry of Transport at Invalidenpark in Berlin - Mitte to call for climate protection. They were against the decisions of the governing coalition of SPD, The Greens, and FDP.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 31 March 2023, at the call of FFF, around 250 people demonstrated in Munchen to call for climate protection and against the decisions of the governing coalition of SPD, The Greens, and FDP.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 31 March 2023, around 20 people, mostly members of ALG and a Grannies Against the Right activist, demonstrated and blocked traffic at Ernst-Reuter-Platz in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf to call for climate protection as well as more democracy. They demanded the implementation of a societal council.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 31 March 2023, 3 ALG members demonstrated and blocked traffic at the Kohlbrand Bridge in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte to call for climate protection. Police officers intervened to remove the demonstrators glued on the road and arrested all 3 of them.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 30 March 2023, between 15 and 16 members of Extinction Rebellion demonstrated and blocked traffic around Strassburger Platz in Dresden to call on the government to do more for climate protection. They demanded a traffic turnaround with a fast expansion of public transport affordable for all and more renewable energy.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 29 March 2023, 3 members of Ende Gelaende and Kangaroo Collective demonstrated and 2 of them climbed a vent to unfurl a huge banner with the inscription 'Exit Gas Now' in Erlangen. They called for climate protection and the end of gas as an energy source. Demonstrators gathered on the occasion of the European Gas Conference in Vienna. Police officers rappelled them down the inside of the chimney.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 March 2023, ALG activists blocked the Veddeler Damm in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte, gluing themselves to the tarmac, to call for more climate action. The activists were removed from the street by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 27 March 2023, 7 ALG activists blocked a street in Stuttgart to demand climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 26 March 2023, at the call of BUND, people gathered in front of the Bavarian ministry of traffic in Munchen to demand climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 26 March 2023, at the call of ALG, around 40 people gathered to cycle on the A9 highway in Munchen, to demand more climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 25 March 2023, at the call of FFF and other environmental groups, around 1,200 (according to police) to 7,000 (according to organizers) people gathered in Berlin - Mitte, to protest in favor of a popular vote taking place the next day which would increase Berlin's climate ambitions.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 25 March 2023, ALG activists blocked the Elbbrucke bridge in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte, gluing themselves to the tarmac, to call for more climate action. data.description: On 4 January 2023, three ALG members demonstrated outside the Federal Ministry of Transport in Berlin - Mitte and attempted to damage the street with jackhammers. Demonstrators denounced freshly paved and consolidated roads, which they claimed would lead to the intensification of climate change. Police officers intervened before the activists could connect the jackhammers to power sources, removing the demonstrators and preventing any form of damage.

data.description: On 4 January 2023, a group of 10 to 15 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic at Dammtor in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) in St. Georg to demand climate protection.
