data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 January 2023, a group of activists and members of the group Extinction Rebellion protested and attempted to tape themselves to a road in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) in St. Georg. They called for the immediate implementation of a 100-km/h speed limit on German highways, as well as stricter speed limits in cities as immediate climate protection measures. Police officers arrived at the scene and prevented protesters from implementing their protest and taping themselves to the road, removing them from the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 22 December 2022, 4 ALG activists demonstrated and blocked traffic in Berlin - Tempelhof-Schoneberg (Hauptstrasse exit) around the highway A100 to call for climate protection. Police officers intervened to unblock the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 December 2022, at least 10 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Munchen to call for climate protection. 10 people were arrested.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 December 2022, members of Extinction Rebellion demonstrated and tried to block traffic in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) on the approach road to the Kennedy Bridge in the direction of Dammtor, to call for climate protection and denounce the criminalization of climate activists.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 December 2022, 8 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic at the intersection Seestrasse, corner Beusselstrasse near the A100 in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf to call for climate protection, a 100km/h speed limit, a 9-euro public transportation ticket for all, and an end to fossil fuel energies. Police officers intervened to remove the demonstrators who glued themselves to the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 December 2022, at least 10 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic at the Stachus station on Sonnenstrasse in Munchen to call for climate protection. 10 people were arrested.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 19 December 2022, 12 members of ALG demonstrated and occupied both lanes of Federal Highway 3 in Freiburg im Breisgau to call for climate protection. Police officers intervened to remove demonstrators.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 17 December 2022, climate activists, including members of FFF and 'End Fossil', demonstrated in Regensburg for the preservation of the village of Lutzerath on the edge of the Rhenish open-cast lignite mine Garzweiler. They called on the government to react against a possible climate catastrophe.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 17 December 2022, during the afternoon, around 30 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic at Potsdamer Platz in Berlin - Mitte to call for climate protection and denounce the detention of members of ALG in Bavaria. Police forces tried to remove the 5 blockers from the roadway.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 17 December 2022, around 100 people, including End Fossil and ALG members, demonstrated at Weender Tor in Gottingen (along Berliner Strasse to Groner Tor) to call for the release of all currently imprisoned climate activists. They denounced the criminalization of the climate movement.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 December 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic at the intersection of Spandauer Damm/Konigin-Elisabeth-Strasse in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 15 December 2022, 9 members of ALG blocked traffic around the Reichstag building (at Paul Loebe House and Marie Elisabeth Luders House) in Berlin - Mitte to bring the issue of climate protection to the attention of the members of parliament. Police officers detached the peaceful demonstrators from the street and took them away.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 14 December 2022, around 20 members of ALG blocked traffic and demonstrated in Berlin to call for climate protection, a 100km/h speed limit on highways, and a 9-euro public transport ticket for all.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 12 December 2022, during the morning, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked highway access roads (A115) in Berlin to call for climate protection and a 9-euro public transportation ticket for all. They demanded the end of fossil fuel energies and the implementation of a 100km/h speed limit on highways.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 12 December 2022, during the afternoon, around 44 members of ALG demonstrated, while 3 of them blocked traffic, at Innsbrucker Platz in Berlin - Tempelhof-Schoneberg to call for climate protection, a 9-euro public transport ticket, and a 100km/h speed limit on highways. They also demanded the end of fossil fuel energies. 2 people were arrested.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 10 December 2022, nearly 300 people, at the call of the 'Enough is enough' local alliance (which includes Ver.di, FFF, students, Seebruecke, Climate camp, Motorcycle club Kuhle Wampe, and the 'Rent Alliance'), demonstrated in Freiburg im Breisgau at the Old Synagogue Square against social inequality amid inflation.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
organizers: NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union
data.description: On 10 December 2022, more than 40 people, at the call of Extinction Rebellion, BUND, NAJU (the youth branch of NABU), GJ, and FFF, demonstrated at the Old Market, in front of the state parliament, in Potsdam to denounce the worldwide extinction of species and call for climate protection. They dressed up as animals and plants and held a symbolic minute of silence on the occasion of the 15th United Nations Biodiversity Conference taking place in Montreal (Canada) on that day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 9 December 2022, around 10 members of ALG blocked the Konstanzer Strasse highway exit (A100) in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf to call for climate protection. Police officers detached the protesters from the road and carried them away.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 9 December 2022, 6 members of ALG demonstrated in Mainz and blocked traffic on a main access road to denounce the climate emergency. Police officers intervened to remove the demonstrators who glued themselves to the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 8 December 2022, members of ALG demonstrated at the Munich Airport in Munchen to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 8 December 2022, 5 members of ALG demonstrated at Berlin Central Station at Europaplatz in Berlin - Mitte to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 8 December 2022, 8 members of ALG demonstrated at the BER airport in Schoenefeld to call for climate protection and a 9-euro public transportation ticket for all. Demonstrators cut through a fence, and two activists managed to stick themselves to an apron near the fence. They didn't get to the runway. Six other activists did not penetrate the site.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 8 December 2022, 7 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Dresden around Nurnberger Street at the Technical University (TU) to call for climate protection. Police officers intervened physically (by using oil) to remove the demonstrators glued to the street.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 December 2022, 6 members of ALG blocked two intersections in Berlin - Mitte, at the corner of Unter den Linden/Friedrichstrasse and Alte Potsdamer to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 December 2022, 11 members of ALG gathered at several places in Munchen, at the intersection of Prielmayerstrasse/Karlsplatz, around the highway A9, and A96, and blocked traffic to call for climate protection. Police officers intervened to disperse the blockades.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 December 2022, 4 people, members of ALG, demonstrated and blocked traffic at Wilhelmstrasse, corner Hallesches Ufer, and Stresemannstrasse, in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg to call for climate protection. They demanded a 100km/h speed limit and a 9-euro public transportation ticket for all.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 December 2022, 11 people, members of ALG, demonstrated and blocked traffic in front of the main train station in Invalidenstrasse, and also at Potsdamer Strasse, corner Varian-Fry-Strasse, in Berlin - Mitte to call for climate protection. They demanded a 100km/h speed limit and a 9-euro public transportation ticket for all.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 December 2022, 9 members of ALG blocked traffic, glued themselves to the roadway at Karlsplatz, and others climbed with posters onto gantries on highways A9 and A96, in Munchen to call for climate protection. They demanded a 100km/h speed limit and a 9-euro public transportation ticket for all. Police forces intervened to arrest the demonstrators and removed them from the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 December 2022, around a dozen people, mostly members of ALG and an elected official (The Greens), demonstrated and blocked traffic at the Weender Tor in Gottingen to call for climate protection. Demonstrators were carried off the street by police officers and firefighters helped remove the glue from those who stuck themselves to the road.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 December 2022, around 1,200 people, including FFF members, demonstrated at the call of unions (Ver.di, DGB) in Saarbrucken for more social justice. Demonstrators argued that social justice had to be achieved with climate protection and that renewable energies are cheaper in the long run than coal, oil, and gas. They denounced poverty, homelessness, and inflation.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 December 2022, in the morning, 4 members of ALG blocked traffic on the city ring road in Leipzig to call for climate protection. They demanded a 100km/h speed limit and a 9-euro public transportation ticket for all. Police officers intervened physically to remove two activists who glued themselves to the road and arrested all 4 activists.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 29 November 2022, 5 members of ALG demonstrated in Mannheim, glued themselves to the road at the Kaiserring intersection, and blocked traffic to call for climate protection. Demonstrators demanded a 100km/h speed limit on highways and a 9-euro public transportation ticket for everyone.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 November 2022, 11 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked a central street in downtown Braunschweig to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 November 2022, numerous members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Ulm at the intersection of Olgastrasse and Neutorstrasse to call for climate protection, a 100 km/h speed limit on highways, and an all-inclusive, public transportation 9-euro ticket for all.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 25 November 2022, Greenpeace activists staged a demonstration outside the Amazon Deutschland headquarters in Munchen, where they unfurled a 90 square-meter banner, to protest against Black Friday and demand more climate action from the company.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 25 November 2022, in the afternoon, two dozen Extinction Rebellion activists briefly blocked the Karmarschstrasse, Schmiedestrasse, and Marktstrasse intersection in Hannover to demand urgent climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 25 November 2022, in the afternoon, about 30 Extinction Rebellion activists staged a performance outside the Europa-Passage shopping center in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) to call for a Black Friday boycott and demand climate action. They waved flares and banners, and subsequently took part in a march toward the former Karstadt Sport building.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 24 November 2022, in the morning, 7 ALG activists staged a protest on Innere Kanalstrasse in Koln, with five of them gluing themselves to the road and blocking traffic, to demand urgent climate action. Glued activists were eventually 'freed' by police forces and firefighters using a solvent. Shortly after, one activist sought to block the road again and was consequently taken into custody by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 24 November 2022, in the afternoon, at least 6 ALG activists cut through fences and entered the grounds (from two distinct points) of the Berlin Brandenburg Airport in Schoenefeld, where some of them held banners, while others glued their hands to the tarmac or rode bicycles through the shunting area, thus briefly blocking air traffic. They demanded urgent climate action. Several activists were taken into custody by the police and faced charges linked to 'dangerous interference with air traffic' at the time of reporting.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 November 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Aalen on B29 Frieder Zurcher to demand climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 November 2022, 3 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Magdeburg to call for climate protection. Demonstrators demanded a highway speed limit of 100km/h and a permanent 9-euro ticket for buses and trains. They glued themselves to a main road and police officers intervened physically to remove them.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 14 November 2022, 8 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in the Messedamm/Neue Kantstrase area, around a highway (A111), in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 14 November 2022, 6 members of ALG blocked traffic and demonstrated at the A100 junction Tempelhofer Damm and Sachsendamm in Berlin - Tempelhof-Schoneberg to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 12 November 2022, at the call of BUND, the Diocesan Council of Catholics, Campact, FFF, Greenpeace, Climate Alliance Germany, and 'All Villages Remain', between 1,000 (according to the police) and 2,200 people (according to organizers), including environmental activists, demonstrated in Lutzerath at the Garzweiler open-pit lignite mine against the mine and the destruction of villages it will cause. A small group of people entered the open pit mine to put down a banner. People from Erkelenz participated.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 11 November 2022, around 150 people, mostly FFF members, cycled and demonstrated in Halle (Saale) to call for climate protection on the occasion of CO27 in Egypt. They cycled from Universitatsplatz to Passage 13 in Neustadt.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 11 November 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Frankfurter Tor) to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 8 November 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked the entrance to the Federal Ministry of Transport in Berlin - Mitte to call for immediate action to limit the climate crisis, such as a speed limit on highways and a permanent 9-euro ticket for public transportation.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 November 2022, around 50 people, mostly activists from 'End Fossil: Occupy', FFF, Students for Future, 'Young Struggle', occupied the Audimax at the Duisburg campus of the University of Duisburg-Essen (UDE) in Duisburg to call for climate justice and against fossil energies. They also were in solidarity with the village of Lutzerath.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 November 2022, 5 members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Munchen (at the Stachus, Altstadtring) to call on the government to do more to tackle climate change. They also denounced previous arrests. Police officers arrested the activists.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 November 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg for climate protection. There was a scuffle between motorists and blockers.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 6 November 2022, 3 members of ALG tried to spray paint on the walls of the Bavarian State Chancellery in Munchen to call for climate protection but police officers stopped the action and arrested them.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 5 November 2022, members of FFF (including Parents For Future) demonstrated in Dresden to call for climate protection. They denounced how the war in Ukraine has serious climatic consequences on the planet. They gathered on the occasion of International Day for Preventing the Exploitation of the Environment in War and Armed Conflict.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 4 November 2022, ALG activists staged a road blockade on the corner of Berliner Torstrasse and Brunnenstrasse and on Spandauer Strasse in Berlin - Mitte to demand more climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 November 2022, climate activists and representatives of around a dozen climate groups (Catholic Diocesan Council of the Aachen diocese, the initiatives 'Alle Dorfer bleiben', 'RWE-Tribunal' and 'Kirche(n) im Dorf lassen', 'Umweltinstitut Munchen', Attac, the Cologne section of Parents For Future and the anti-nuclear movement 'Ausgestrahlt') staged a rally outside the Heukamp-Hof occupied farm in Lutzerath to oppose the exploitation of the Garzweiler open-pit lignite mine.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 November 2022, at the call of the Munster branches of Fridays for Future, Greenpeace, Seebrucke and Klima-Entscheid, more than 1,000 people, including a professor and co-founder of Scientists for Future, marched from Schlossplatz to Stubengasse in Munster to call for more climate action and justice around the world. The event was organized on the occasion of the G7 Foreign Ministers Summit hosted by the city on 3 and 4 November 2022.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 November 2022, ALG activists staged a road blockade in Berlin, blocking traffic, to demand more climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 November 2022, ALG activists staged a road blockade in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf to demand more climate action, as well as a 100 km/h speed limit and the introduction of an all-inclusive 9-euro transportation ticket.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 November 2022, five ALG activists staged a road blockade at a traffic light at the corner of Bismarckallee and Wilhelmstrasse in Freiburg im Breisgau to demand more climate action, and notably a 100-km/h speed limit on highways. All five activists were removed from the street by the police.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 3 November 2022, in the morning, 17 ALG activists staged a road blockade near Karlsplatz in Munchen, obstructing traffic, to demand climate action. The activists were taken into custody by the police, and released in the afternoon. 15 of the activists subsequently staged another road blockade, and some of them glued themselves to the road. They were removed by the police and some of them were arrested.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 2 November 2022, 3 members of ALG demonstrated and glued themselves to the wall of the Green Party's federal headquarters in Berlin - Mitte to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 October 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic at the exit Kaiserdamm in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf for climate protection. A total of 25 people were involved in all the events in Berlin that same day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 October 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Mehringdamm) for climate protection. A total of 25 people were involved in all the events in Berlin that same day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 October 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Berlin - Mitte (Torstrasse/corner of Schonhauser Allee) for climate protection. A total of 25 people were involved in all the events in Berlin that same day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 October 2022, members of ALG demonstrated and blocked traffic in Berlin - Pankow (Danziger street) for climate protection. A total of 25 people were involved in all the events in Berlin that same day.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 October 2022, members of Scientist Rebellion, and ALG demonstrated in Munchen and blocked Karlsstrasse to call for climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 26 October 2022, 15 members of ALG demonstrated in Munchen - Maxvorstadt in the area of Brienner Street and Odeonsplatz to call for the immediate abandonment of fossil fuel in the transport sector and climate protection.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 26 October 2022, several members of ALG demonstrated in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf at Messedamm and Jakob-Kaiser-Platz and blocked traffic to call for a 100km/h speed limit on highways, a 9-Euro ticker for public transportation, and climate protection. data.description: On 2 July 2022, between 1,400 and 4,000 people, including students, employees (Siemens, Thyssen, Volkswagen), communists, anti-militarists, Palestinians, dockworkers, Grannies Against the Right, Antifa, members of SDAJ, GEW, Ver.di, VVN-BdA, MLPD, IB, The Left, FVC, and ATIK, demonstrated in Bebelplatz in Berlin - Mitte for peace in Ukraine and against the rearmament amid the war in Ukraine. Demonstrators were against the government's decision to dedicate 100 billion euros to military spending and called for the funds to be used on social welfare, health, education, culture, and climate protection. The demonstration was organized by a group called 'Civilian change of times' (ZZ).

The victim suffered a broken collarbone and a mild concussion, and the police confirmed that one demonstrator was injured.

data.description: On 29 May 2022, around 700 people, including some who cycled from Bad Honnef, Wachtberg, Bornheim and other cities, demonstrated in Bonn [coded to Bonn] at the call of 'Transport Turnaround Now' (VJ) to demand more non-motorized mobility and climate protection. Demonstrators were also against highway projects such as 'Rheinspange 553'. Around 150 people, including FFF, ADFC, LSV members, farmers, and people from Alfter, joined the demonstration after protesting in Bornheim.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 29 May 2022, around 600 people, including members of BUND, Extinction Rebellion, and FFF, demonstrated in Leipzig against the construction of the coastal highway (A20) between Westerstede and Jaderberg and its consequences on climate.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 27 May 2022, between 250-300 activists protested in Kiel for more climate protection days after the beginning of coalition negotiations between the CDU and the Green Party. Protesters demanded the new government to guarantee a faster expansion of wind energy, climate neutral rail connections and an end to subsidies for fossil fuels.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 May 2022, members of the Fridays for Future movement announced a strike and protested in Koln to demand a social-ecological transition for Nordrhein Westfalen and called for the future government to pursue climate policies to protect the environment.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 21 May 2022, around 500 members of Fridays for Future demonstrated in Koln at the Roncalliplatz to demand more climate justice. Protesters also demanded climate protection after state elections recently took place.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 May 2022, members of ALG demonstrated in Munchen for a law concerning food waste and to call for better policies to tackle climate change. Demonstrators glued their hands on the road and blocked traffic.

data.description: On 8 January 2022, around 1 pm, about 15 ER activists staged a peaceful road blockade on the B5 in Hamburg - Bergedorf (Hamburg) to call for more climate action. One activist injured his shoulder due to the abrupt motion.

data.description: On 31 October 2021, between 1,000 (according to the police) and 5,000 (according to organizers) environmental activists, including Greenpeace, Ende Gelaende and FFF members, demonstrated from Lutzerath to Immerath [coded to Immerath] back and forth against the Garzweiler II open-pit that could allegedly destroy villages. data.description: On 22 September 2021, around 50 people, mostly FFF members, protested in Rottenburg am Neckar for climate justice. Protesters highlighted the failures of the CDU political party concerning climate change matters.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 19 September 2021, several hundred cyclists from the ADFC protested by staging a ride starting near the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin - Mitte to call for less space for cars and more cycling infrastructure. Protesters called on authorities to implement more environmentally friendly transportation to tackle climate change.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 18 September 2021, between 1000 (according to the police) and 2000 (according to organizers) people, mostly from the Indivisible (Unteilbar) movement, Antifa, Black Bloc, and FFF, protested in Rostock to call for climate and social justice. Protesters denounced racism.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 17 September 2021, around 30 people, mostly Extinction Rebellion members, protested in Heidelberg to call for climate justice. Protesters staged a funeral march with a coffin through the city center.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 15 September 2021, 5 Extinction Rebellion activists protested in Dusseldorf to call on the government to implement concrete measures to tackle climate change. Two of them climbed onto the roof of the underground parking garage.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 14 September 2021, 32 people, including Extinction Rebellion members and students, protested in Heidelberg to raise awareness about climate change and urge authorities to implement solutions to tackle this issue. They called for people to vote for an environmental-friendly political party on 26 September 2021.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 11 September 2021, between 10000 (according to the police) and 25000 (according to organizers) people from all over Germany, including cyclists and activists (ADFC, Attac, BUND, Campact, Greenpeace, VCD), protested in Munchen against the 2021 International Motor Show Germany (IAA Mobility) and to raise awareness about climate change. Protesters called on authorities to implement the use of non-polluting means of transportation.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 11 September 2021, around 600 cyclists and ADFC members cycled through the city and stopped in front of a train station in Grafelfing against the 2021 International Motor Show Germany (IAA Mobility) and to raise awareness about climate change. Protesters took a break and then cycled to join the protest in Munchen.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 11 September 2021, around 60 cyclists and ADFC members protested in the city center in Holzkirchen against the 2021 International Motor Show Germany (IAA Mobility) and to raise awareness about climate change. Protesters cycled and joined the protest in Munchen.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 11 September 2021, around 160 cyclists and ADFC members protested in the city center of Taufkirchen (Vils) against the 2021 International Motor Show Germany (IAA Mobility) and to raise awareness about climate change. Protesters cycled and joined the protest in Munchen.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 10 September 2021, more than 1000 people, including activists (Attac, FFF, The Greens), demonstrated in several places in Munchen against the 2021 International Motor Show Germany (IAA Mobility) and to raise awareness about climate change. People occupied a building and were physically dispersed by the police. Other demonstrators tried to break through a police barrier and were pushed back with pepper spray and batons. Another group blocked a road and were dispersed. Between 16 and 30 activists were arrested.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 10 September 2021, people, including Extinction Rebellion members, protested in Heidelberg to raise awareness about climate change and urge authorities to implement solutions to tackle this issue. Protesters called for people to vote for an environmental-friendly political party on 26 September 2021.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 7 September 2021, Greenpeace activists protested in Munchen against the 2021 International Motor Show Germany (IAA Mobility) and to raise awareness about climate change.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 4 September 2021, between 10000 (according to the police) and 30000 (according to organizers) people from the 'Unteilbar' (Indivisible) movement, including activists (feminists, union members, FFF, AI, MLPD, IB), students, people from the Afghan community, and Afghan refugees, protested in Berlin - Mitte to call for an inclusive society. Protesters were against the AfD political party and capitalism. Protesters called on authorities to implement sustainable solutions against militarization, climate change, and for the protection of refugees, anti-racism, and the right to housing. 2 people who tried to tear down election placards were arrested.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 28 August 2021, around 200 to 400 people protested in Stade against the planned expansion of the highway A20 and its impact on the environment and climate. The protest was organized, amongst others, by BUND, FFF, Ende Gelaende and VCD.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 27 August 2021, around 1,000 Fridays for Future and Campact activists protested in Dusseldorf against the CDU Chancellor candidate Armin Laschet and his climate policy.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 August 2021, people, including ADFC activists, protested in Karlsruhe at the call of Students for Future to draw attention to the climate crisis.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 August 2021, around 70 Fridays for Future activists protested in Koln for more climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 August 2021, around 20 Fridays for Future activists protested in Moosburg for more climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 August 2021, around 200 Fridays for Future activists protested in Bonn for more climate action.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 20 August 2021, around 200 Extinction Rebellion activists protested at Brandenburg Gate in Berlin - Mitte for more climate action. Several activists climbed the Brandenburger Tor. Police interfered and physically removed the protesters.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: Around 19 August 2021 (as reported), Fridays for Future activists protested in Oldenburg against the NRW Minister President and Chancellor candidate Armin Laschet and his climate policy.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 19 August 2021, around 150 Extinction Rebellion activists protested in Berlin - Mitte by blocking the street outside the Ministry for Agriculture for more climate action. Police had to carry protesters off the street. In the afternoon, around 100 activists protested with fish nets and banners. Another 50 to 60 activists tried to block a car dealer shop.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 18 August 2021, Greenpeace activists protested in Berlin - Mitte outside the Chancellery for more climate action ahead of a meeting between the Chancellor and representatives of the automotive industry.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 18 August 2021, several hundred Extinction Rebellion activists protested in Berlin - Mitte for more climate action. The activists protested outside and entered the CDU Economic Council office. Police intervened and accompanied the protesters out of the office and carried others off the street. Other activists dumped coal outside the NRW state representation in Berlin.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 16 August 2021, around 300 activists, including Extinction Rebellion activists, protested with blockades in Berlin - Mitte for more climate action. Police intervened and carried off some of the protesters. Activists also set up a camp in Monbijou Park. Some activists were detained.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 15 August 2021, between 700 to 1,000 people protested in Berlin - Mitte with a cycle rally at the call of the ADFC for more climate justice and a transportation reform.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com
data.description: On 13 August 2021, around 4,500 to 15,000 Fridays for Future activists protested in Frankfurt am Main for more climate action, in particular by the financial sector, and against investments that are harmful to the climate and environment.

data.source: adapted from: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); www.acleddata.com

data.description: Around 18 December 2020 (as reported), climate activists of the Weinheim climate alliance (including, amongst others, BUND, NABU, The Greens, Jusos and the ADFC) held a vigil in Weinheim to demand adherence to the Paris Agreement.

data.description: On 12 December 2020, several hundred climate activists, including Ende Gelaende activists, protested in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf (Berlin), with a bike rally over the A100 to the Funkturm triangle, to protest for the adherence to the Paris Agreement. Two activists let themselves down on a rope from a bridge to uncover a banner, while 15 activists tried to reveal a banner on another bridge. Both protest actions were stopped by police. It is unclear if it was stopped by physical or verbal interference.

data.description: On 12 December 2020, around 500 climate activists protested with a bike ride in Gottingen against the construction of highways. The protest was organized by Ende Gelaende and the Basisdemokratische Linke which is part of the Interventionist Left.
